headline: Jalapeno Bacon Cheddar Deviled Eggs
description: Jalapeno, bacon, and Cheddar cheese make everything better - including deviled eggs!

video.description: A spicy change to regular deviled eggs.
video.name: Jalapeno Bacon Cheddar Deviled Eggs

name: Jalapeno Bacon Cheddar Deviled Eggs
recipeIngredient: 1 cup finely shredded sharp Cheddar cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Place eggs in a saucepan; cover with water. Bring to a boil, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in hot water for 15 minutes. Remove eggs from hot water, cool under cold running water, and peel.
Place bacon in a large skillet; cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon on paper towels; crumble when cool enough to handle.
Remove seeds and stems from jalapenos; mince 1 pepper and slice remaining peppers into very thin strips; set aside.
Cut eggs in half lengthwise; place yolks in a bowl. Mash egg yolks with a fork; stir in minced jalapeno, Cheddar cheese, mayonnaise, red onion, and mustard.
Place egg whites cut-side up on a serving platter. Spoon yolk mixture into egg white halves; sprinkle with crumbled bacon and paprika.

review.reviewBody: Best Deviled eggs I've ever had! Made them for a labor day party & they were a big hit ... everyone loved them! I used sweet heat peppers from my garden and probably used more bacon, but otherwise followed the recipe. Making them again today for a work birthday celebration tomorrow!
Fabulous recipe

I wanted to love this recipe, but the first two steps are way off. Bacon should be cooked low and slow-10 minutes on medium/high = burnt. Likewise, the eggs were made exactly following the directions and were still runny. I’d definitely cover the eggs after boiling to hold in the heat. Maybe boil, remove from heat, cover 8-10 mins. Anyways, I hope I’m able to salvage this mess of a recipe.

These turned out great! I added about a half cup more of mayo. Added minced jalapeno WITH seeds. Everyone enjoyed them. Thanks for sharing. 

Next time I make these, I'm subbing the minced jalapeno with a puréed habenero (no seeds), and keeping the jalapenos as the garnish. I like it spicy!
Not real flavorful for all the work involved.
It was a hit with friends and family. I used pickled jalapeños and a couple dashes of hot sauce. All gone!!!
Winner! Winner! Thanks

Added the left over jalapeno slices to the top. Used pre-packaged bacon crumbles in place of the crumbled bacon as I managed to burn an entire package of bacon and it turned out really well! Also added a touch of prepared horseradish for a little extra "kick".

These taste wonderful, and didn’t last more than an hour at Superbowl! I followed the recipe exactly, but next time, I’ll add a little more jalapeño to the mix for more heat. One side note I’d like to make- You can make these the night before, but don’t fry and add the bacon until you’re ready to serve. I made this mistake, and the bacon was soggy and flaccid by morning. I will definitely be making these babies again!
This is my first time making them so I did not change anything except to add a little salt. They were delicious!!
For an extra kick, use Smoked half sharp Hungarian Paprika for the dusting... It is SO much better than the standard Spanish Sweet

It's okay, not as spicy a I thought it would be, I am going to add one or two more jalapenos to give it a little kick. With one jalapeno, I can't even taste the pepper, no kick. Otherwise, a very nice variation on a traditional favorite.
This was delicious and a big hit at a party!
Yummy
Just made this recipe, and these eggs are sooo delicious! You should definitely whip up some too! And don’t forget the slivers of jalapeño for garnish.
Only change was we used one larger jalapeño instead of three small, and miracle whip instead of mayo. It was awesome!
Peppers I used had no heat to them at all so for my taste I could have added some cayenne; my wife, however, loved them. and we made a second batch for a get together with her friends.
Make sure to make extras. They will all be gone!
Everyone loved them! Not at all spicy. I am going to try leaving the seeds in the minced jalapeno that is added to the egg yolk mixture.
I've been requested to make these for all holidays. Have been for a few years.
Used serrano peppers instead of jalapenos. I also used Grey Poupon mustard instead of brown mustard. Turned out amazing. I also added minced garlic.

Made these for 4th of July party. They were delicious. Some friends were afraid to try them because I labeled them jalapeno, but since I took out the seeds & membrane, they had some kick, but were not HOT. I did half the mustard. The recipe said 3 jalapenos, and to cut 2 into fine stripes, but did not say what to do with them. One picture had them "sticking out" of the egg, but the picture with the recipe didn't. That is what I did. It also helped "labeled them" as the jalapeno eggs as opposed to the other regular deviled eggs I made. You should explain what to do with those 2 peppers .
It never did say what your suppose to do with the other 2 Jalapeno peppers.
Full of flavor. Easy & filling treat.
Made as the recipe stated and they were Delish!!! A Big hit with everyone!! Awesome!!

Delicious!!! We loved these. To satisfy all tastes I substituted red onion with yellow and lessened the amount so as not to overpower. We put the jalapeño on top instead of mixing it in, which was great for those who didn't want too much heat.
The flavors of all the ingredients did not mesh together well. The cheese being the main one. This is just ok. I will not make again.
Possibly the yummiest appetizer I have ever made. Didn't alter a thing.
Very yummy. Even my picky kids loved them. I do mix the bacon into the mixture before filling the eggs.
I substituted with sriracha mayo and mixed some of the bacon in, as well as using it as a garnish. Everyone loved them. An 8 year old told me they were better than cake!
Is now an office favorite. My boss is a bacon freak so he pans the room for this dish. Thanks for sharing.
I made thies for a Father's Day family gathering and boy were they a hit. People just couldn't get over what a great change to a traditional appetizer this recipe was.
Delicious!

I used the following modifications (based on what I had at home). 1/2 the egg yolks, 1/2 of regular mayo, 1/2 of the spicy mustard, 1/2 the cheese, 1 tsp of hot sauce, and the full amount of jalapenos and bacon. All of those ingredients were pureed and then added mayo, spicy mustard and more hot sauce to taste. I used my large cupcake decorating kit to put into the egg halves and topped with crumbled bacon (adding cheese and jalapenos would look nice as well). I'm not a huge deviled egg fan, but between the guests and myself, this was our favorite recipe ahead of the buffalo blue cheese deviled eggs. This will be my go to party food.
Awesome. Add a little more mayo for a creamier filling.
came out very good, needs more bacon. No mention tho on what to do with sliced jalapeno....
These are a fav around my house. They are usually gone within 30 minutes. Great for any get together, including football parties. It's rare to see regular deviled eggs anymore here!
Between the bacon and the cheddar cheese they were just too salty. Unfortunately, the jalapeno I bought had very little heat. Overall, not what I expected.

Excellent and easy - crowd favorite. Spice intolerant friends so used mild whole Chili peppers and they worked wonderfully. Wasn't sure what to do with the sliced peppers called for so draped them over the top of the filling and then put the bacon and paprika on.
I never even liked deviled eggs before this recipe. I’m obsessed but I also love fresh jalapeños, & bacon of course! I use a little bit of the bacon grease in the mix too. Highly recommended!!
Love it!
Delicious! My family raved about these, none left after Thanksgiving dinner, unfortunately for me. I did add black pepper, dill, and smoked paprika for a little more flavor.
Both my son and I thought these were the best deviled eggs we've ever had (so far). So many recipes, so little time.

Very good. Next time I will leave out the mustard, or use much less, or sub a bit of vinegar. Just too many flavors competing, for me. I wanted to taste more of the cheese and bacon but felt that the mustard competed and didn't really add to the overall flavors.

I've made this twice so far - they are better than regular deviled eggs. I have farm fresh eggs and am always looking for a way to use them. I did 18 of them with 3 large jalapenos, increasing the other ingredients by 50% I used lite mayo and regular yellow mustard & paprika, skipping the onion. Took them to a potluck and they were gone in a flash.
I made these for easter and i left out the onions but they turned out good not spicy though next time i might leave in the seeds
Took these for Easter dinner. I am not usually a fan of deviled eggs but I really liked these. I come from a family of cooks and everyone loved them. I used light Hellmans and they were great!
Great recipe! I used half chipotle mayo, doubled the bacon and mixed the bacon strait into the egg yolks. Everyone loved it :)

Made this once. Now I'm required to make them for every function. Of course I put my own little spin on them with applewood smoked bacon and more cheese. I also add more smoked paprika to give them a more smoky flavor.
Killer!!! So so good! Thank you!
Delicious! I think next time I will keep a bit of the seeds/membranes in the peppers to give them a little spice, but other than that, these were great...a keeper~YUM! Thanks for sharing. :)

Yummy! But then what's not to love? I used a red jalapeno and Dijon mustard and followed the recipe. No salt or pepper needed in these! I want to try these with all different kinds of mustard! Thank you so much, Russell!
